text: Camera type (bullet, dome, PTZ), resolution, field of view, and mounting verified with spec and layout
Camera coverage map reviewed with critical area visibility checked (entrances, corridors, parking, elevators)
NVR/DVR sizing, hard drive capacity, video retention period meet spec (typically 30–90 days)
Cameras mounted level, aligned, and protected from vandalism/environment
Camera junction boxes, pole brackets, and armatures installed securely
IP address assigned, MAC address logged, and connection to POE switch/NVR confirmed
CAT6 or coaxial cable terminated correctly and tested for continuity and speed
POE switches installed and labeled; power budget per port verified
Surge protection and grounding provided at key panels and field terminations
NVR mounted in secure location, with UPS backup and HVAC cooling
Time, resolution, camera naming, frame rate, and retention settings configured
Remote viewing stations and login permissions tested and documented
Live view, motion detection, night vision, and PTZ controls (if applicable) tested
Recorded playback tested for quality, date/time stamp, and exported formats
As-built camera map, user manual, and commissioning documents submitted
